oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 11 g
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 11 g. Newspaper clipping: Meeting Of Club Women Is Called.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Women's suffrage;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: MEETING OF CLUB WOMEN IS CALLED Plans Will Be Made to Entertain State Convention. Mrs. L. Crozier French, president of the Tennessee Equal Suffrage league, has called a meeting of all representative women of this city to be held this morning in the board of commerce parlors, at ten o'clock. This meeting is for the purpose of discussing ways and means for Knox- ville's entertainment of the Tennessee Suffrage association, which convenes in this city October 27, 28 and 29. Attending this convention will be a number of the most prominent and influential women of the state, socially and in club work, and the gathering will also be attended by notable suffrage workers from eact (sic.) and west. The personnel of the convention will be quite distinguished, and Knoxville women must, if they are to make this gathering what it has been in other cities, be up and doing, say local leaders. Not only will members of the local suffrage league be interested in these visitors, but every club woman of the city, every woman prominent in social circles, will find that the guestlist of this convention includes names of women whom she would gladly entertain in one way or another. Mrs. French, a representative of one of the oldest and best families of this city, feels that Knoxville women will be glad to uphold the city's reputation for hospitality in connection with this convention. Mrs. French will be pleased to see this morning all Knoxville women who are interested. The meeting will be held promptly at ten o'clock" and will be brief.
